newsitem.title: FRANCE: France's 1997 budget aims to lighten taxes-Arthuis.
newsitem.headline: France's 1997 budget aims to lighten taxes-Arthuis.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said France's 1997 budget was aimed at lowering taxes and controlling spending to help France meet budget-deficit criteria for the single European currency.
"It's a budget that is marked by the aim of controlling spending, lightening the tax burden and respecting (Maastricht treaty) convergence criteria," Arthuis said in a radio interview.
"We will hold public deficits to four percent of GDP in 1996 and three percent in 1997," he said.
